definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: The lake lies low by the hill, a tearful entreaty of love at the foot of the inflexible.
sentences.chinese: 湖躺在山腳下，像在執拗者的跟前含淚懇求愛。

sentences.english: But in the face of homosexuality wooer, female showed remarkably higher percentage of rejection than male.
sentences.chinese: 但對同性戀的求愛，女生拒絕的比例明顯高於男生。

sentences.english: Not obtrusive, go up pertly courtship, you can refuse for certain.
sentences.chinese: 不要莽撞，冒冒失失上去求愛，你肯定會遭拒絕。

sentences.english: 'I haven't offended you often by love-making?
sentences.chinese: 我向你求愛，並沒有常常故意惹你生氣啊？

sentences.english: He showed his remarkable endurance throughout the courtship.
sentences.chinese: 他在求愛期間展現了非凡的忍耐力。

sentences.english: Follows isolde, but not love a field.
sentences.chinese: 不求蕩氣迴腸，只求愛一場。

sentences.english: He is one of the courtiers to this girl.
sentences.chinese: 他是這個女孩的求愛者之一。

sentences.english: The young man courted the young lady by bring her flowers every day.
sentences.chinese: 那青年通過每天給那女子送花而向她求愛。

sentences.english: Just one whiff flips the switch on courtship-initiating brain pathways.
sentences.chinese: 在大腦中求愛的慾望就如同吹起的翻轉風車。

sentences.english: Emperor Qianlong visited the Pomegranate Garden, paying court to Pomegranate Blossom Fairy.
sentences.chinese: 乾隆微服私訪石榴園，向榴花仙女求愛。

sentences.english: This had been the signal in old times when Wildeve had used to come secretly wooing to her.
sentences.chinese: 這本是韋狄從前祕密向她求愛的時候用的暗號。

sentences.english: It was, in a sense, a second courtship.
sentences.chinese: 從某種意義上說，這是一次二度求愛期。

sentences.english: I don’t often write love letters to gadgets.
sentences.chinese: 我不常給那些小玩意兒寫求愛信。

sentences.english: When it comes to courtship, females do favor flashier males.
sentences.chinese: 當談到求愛，女性更青睞華麗的男性。

sentences.english: Do you know why she refused my love?
sentences.chinese: 你知道她爲什麼拒絕我的求愛嗎？

definition: original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
to get excited/passionate/aroused to passion/to fall in love/on heat (of animals)
in love with/to feel deeply attached to
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to have no contact with/to be cut off from/(electricity) to insulate
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
